message: And how does google voice replace the voicemail?
Question here (and this might be a dumb one): How does Google Voice work with a carrier's Pay-as-you-go plan? I've got an AT&T pay-as-you go plan w/ no data.
You would need data otherwise you have to call google voice and it will connect you costing you money and voicemail can't replace a current number's voicemail

Italiano40 is correct.  The real advantage is when you have an unlimited data plan.  I can talk using google voice and it doesn't affect my voice minutes. When i get a call , GV will translate the message and email it to me so I don't even have to use  any minutes
Don't you think it's time Google bought a carrier, shut down all their voice stuff and just offered a data plan for using gV & other Android-y things?
@Lloyd what carrier could they buy with nationwide coverage? Would the overhead be worth it to them?

@BrentByington Imagine the money carriers are making already - Google wouldn't have to make any money off it; they could bootstrap the profits of that division into making the network amazing on Google phones (big selling point). Sprint maybe?
